he  provisions  in  section  3(4)  of  the  Sri  Lankan  Act  are  similar  to  those  in
section  4(4)  of  the  High  Court  (Admiralty  Jurisdiction)  Act  of  Singapore.  In
the case of the “Chem Orchid” 2015 SGHC 50, it elaborated the implication
of  the  said  section  (4)  of  (Admiralty  Jurisdiction  Act)  of  Singapore,  with
regard  to  the  liability  which  demised  charterer  may  incur  on  account  of  a
vessel and its implication on the vessel owner. In this regard the High Court
